props.bottom: Expands from the bottom of the screen on mobile devices
props.clipped: A clipped drawer rests under the application toolbar. **Note:** requires the **clipped-left** or **clipped-right** prop on `v-app-bar` to work as intended
props.disableResizeWatcher: Will automatically open/close drawer when resized depending if mobile or desktop.
props.disableRouteWatcher: Disables opening of navigation drawer when route changes
props.expandOnHover: Collapses the drawer to a **mini-variant** until hovering with the mouse
props.floating: A floating drawer has no visible container (no border-right)
props.height: Sets the height of the navigation drawer
props.mobileBreakpoint: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component. This will apply alternate styles for mobile devices such as the `temporary` prop, or activate the `bottom` prop when the breakpoint value is met. Setting the value to `0` will disable this functionality.
props.miniVariantWidth: Designates the width assigned when the `mini` prop is turned on
props.miniVariant: Condenses navigation drawer width, also accepts the **.sync** modifier. With this, the drawer will re-open when clicking it
props.permanent: The drawer remains visible regardless of screen size
props.right: Places the navigation drawer on the right
props.image: Apply a specific background image to the component.
props.temporary: A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a scrim (overlay) to darken the background
props.value: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.
props.railWidth: Sets the width for the component when `rail` is enabled.

slots.append: A slot at the bottom of the drawer
slots.image: Used to modify `v-img` properties when using the **src** prop
slots.prepend: A slot at the top of the drawer

events.transitionend: Emits event object when transition is complete.
events.update:rail: Event that is emitted when the rail model changes
